image.altText: Police officer looks away from camera at a press conference

props.synopsis: The NT government has announced an independent inquiry into dozens of senior police appointments made under ousted commissioner Michael Murphy.

title.children: Inquiry into senior NT police appointments under ousted commissioner

image.altText: A photo which shows Gove refinery from the air. Gove Operations is located on the Gove Peninsula in North East Arnhem land.

props.synopsis: The Commonwealth has lost a High Court battle over whether it should be liable for compensation for lost or impaired native title rights over a mining lease on the Gove Peninsula in North East Arnhem Land.

title.children: Commonwealth loses High Court battle in native title compensation claim over Gove Peninsula

image.altText: NT Police Commissioner Michael Murphy standing at a lectern and looking up.

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory's corruption watchdog has been accused of being a toothless tiger. But after millions of dollars and a rocky first few years, there's an argument that it's finally doing its job.

title.children: Two recent scalps show the NT's corruption watchdog has bite after all

props.synopsis: More than six months into her new role as leader of the Northern Territory's Labor opposition, Selena Uibo reflects on what went wrong for the party in the 2024 NT election.

title.children: Selena Uibo on how crime brought an end to Labor’s long reign in the NT

image.altText: A crocodile in brown water looking straight on at the camera close-up like a portrait.

props.synopsis: A new study suggests nutrient-rich crocodile poop could be benefiting wetland vegetation in the Top End while predation pressure limits feral pig damage.

title.children: Saltwater crocs' feral pig diet may be changing NT waterways

image.altText: A man in a blue apron holds a horse.

props.synopsis: The NT's chief vet says Rupert Trembath has pregnancy-tested an "incredible number" of cows, representing nearly a fifth of the NT's entire herd.

title.children: Flying vet celebrated for pregnancy testing nearly 500,000 cows

image.altText: The Star, Brisbane 2025-01-09 10:01:00

props.synopsis: An ICAC report which uncovered corrupt conduct against an unnamed senior executive in the NT public service has stayed largely out of the spotlight since its release in February.

title.children: Executive resigns after ICAC finds sick leave was spent fishing, at casino

image.altText: A shadowy image of an Aboriginal man and child riding through the outback in the backseat of a car.

props.synopsis: As outback temperatures soar, vulnerable tenants with prepaid power are regularly having their electricity cut, resulting in "appalling" living conditions with huge social ramifications.

title.children: Vulnerable people without power as prepaid electricity cards run out

image.altText: Flames and smoke visible above trees

props.synopsis: Tasmania has been treated to both ends of the weather spectrum, with a bushfire burning near a west coast town as a massive storm front delivers large hail across other parts of the state.

title.children: Fire threat to Tasmanian town gives way to storms, hail

image.altText: A close-up of Donald Trump wearing a white shirt, blue suit jacket and yellow tie

props.synopsis: NASA has announced the dismissal of its chief scientist in its first round of cuts ordered by US President Donald Trump.

title.children: NASA loses chief scientist in first round of Trump-ordered cuts

image.altText: Three people hugging in a crowd

props.synopsis: The centre-right Demokraatit Party has won the most votes in Greenland's parliamentary elections, a surprise result as the territory went to the polls in the shadow of US President Donald Trump's stated goal of taking control of the island one way or another.

title.children: Centre-right party wins Greenland's election as Trump seeks control

image.altText: EU president wears speaking in front of a blue EU flag at a conference

props.synopsis: The European Union is retaliating against US President Donald Trump with "countermeasures" on $45 billion of US goods after his administration increased tariffs on all steel and aluminium imports to 25 per cent.

title.children: EU responds to Donald Trump's tariffs with duties on $45b of US goods

image.altText: A man driving a dingy.

props.synopsis: The family of Victorian Steven Payne, who was killed on WA's remote south coast, say he "loved his partner deeply, cherished his family, thought the world of his best mates, and was devoted to his dog".

title.children: Family of shark attack victim remember 'gentle giant' who wouldn't support cull

image.altText: A man wearing a dark knitted sweater and beanie hugging a woman in a teal dress

props.synopsis: At least 30 insurgents have been killed and 190 hostages freed by Pakistani security forces after separatist militants hijacked a passenger train while armed with explosive vests.

title.children: Authorities free 190 hostages from train hijacked by militants

image.altText: Rod Roberts wearing suit and tie in park

props.synopsis: Hate speech laws were passed in NSW after an explosives-laden caravan was found in Dural alongside a note referencing The Great Synagogue, since revealed to be a hoax. One MP says parliament was "completely misled".

title.children: NSW hate speech bill would have failed if caravan truth was known, MP says

image.altText: Opposition leader Peter Dutton speaking

props.synopsis: For nearly three years now, Peter Dutton has deployed — with considerable success — one of the few orthodox political tactics which remains a good bet even in these strange times: Set expectations low and clear them with ease.

title.children: Dutton is starting to lose his strategic advantage as his popularity rises

image.altText: An aerial shot of a harbour.

props.synopsis: The Australian Maritime Safety Authority is investigating how the divers came to be left behind before being rescued by a passing ferry.

title.children: Two scuba divers left behind in ocean during dive trip

image.altText: A teenage girl whose face is pixelated lies in a hospital bed.

props.synopsis: Kmart is investigating the incident and the 13-year-old girl's mother hopes her story will alert other parents to the potential dangers of products used by young people.

title.children: Kmart pulls skincare product after teen hospitalised with eye pain

props.synopsis: Around the clock coverage of news events as they break at home and abroad.

title.children: ABC News Channel live

image.altText: Blurred numbers on the ASX stock boards

props.synopsis: The Australian share market is now close to what financial market participants call a "technical correction".

title.children: What does a 'slow motion sell-down' mean for our superannuation?

image.altText: A composite image of three men

props.synopsis: After Zelenskyy and Trump's disastrous Oval Office meeting, Russia had a major battlefield advantage. All of that could change.

title.children: 'The ball is now in their court': How Zelenskyy may have outwitted Putin

image.altText: A man stands with several other people at a function

props.synopsis: The WA Greens say strengthening the government’s climate change legislation will be a top priority after they seize the balance of power in the upper house.

title.children: As Labor loses total control, WA's upper house is set to get interesting

image.altText: People lining up to to vote at polling place.

props.synopsis: The Corruption and Crime Commission has been asked to investigate the outsourcing of staffing and donations made by a key company involved in resourcing the WA state election.

title.children: Corruption watchdog urged to probe WA election staff outsourcing

image.altText: Staff follow Mathew Hawkins outside the hotel moments before he punches Luke Sweetman

props.synopsis: South Australia's Supreme Court has released footage of Mathew Hawkins's fatal one-punch attack on Luke Sweetman — who was backing away — when he was struck outside a suburban Adelaide hotel.

title.children: Court releases CCTV of fatal one-punch attack on 'fun-loving' man at Adelaide pub

image.altText: A close up of gloved hands holding an artificial heart made of metal and plastic.

props.synopsis: A New South Wales man with heart failure lived with the artificial heart for over 100 days while waiting to be matched with a heart donor.

title.children: Australian man successfully receives titanium heart after 6-hour operation

image.altText: A middle-aged man with white hair stands in a park and speaks into a microphone.

props.synopsis: Health authorities in Townsville are urging people to take precautions following a rare diphtheria diagnosis and a growing cluster of dengue fever infections.

title.children: Vaccinated teen gets diphtheria amid 'full outbreak response' to dengue cases

image.altText: A blurring image of Andrew Walsh.

props.synopsis: Two men who killed a man and then buried his body in a concrete slab at a Brisbane transport depot three years ago have been handed life sentences.

title.children: Two men sentenced for killing and burying man in concrete slab

image.altText: The woman was last seen wearing a long slim-fitting white dress with a brown leather satchel.

props.synopsis: Crystal Beale's body was found at Yeronga by a member of the public in the early hours of Saturday, February 22.

title.children: Police launch murder probe after woman's body found in Brisbane River

image.altText: A US influencer holding a joey wombat that is in distress with its mouth open

props.synopsis: A US hunting influencer is under fire after posting a video of herself capturing a wild baby wombat off the side of the road.

title.children: US influencer criticised for temporarily taking joey wombat from mother

image.altText: several dead, white fish on sand

props.synopsis: The NSW EPA said it was the sight and stench of dead fish, and not machinery sensors, that prompted their investigation that landed a power station company in court.

title.children: EPA alleges maintenance failure to blame for fish kill near power station

image.altText: A graphic showing Peter Dutton and Anthony Albanese in front of a property.

props.synopsis: The revelation that an explosives-filled caravan initially believed to be part of an antisemitic terror plot was in fact a "criminal con job" has kicked off a convoluted political stoush over who knew what when.

title.children: The caravan and the 'con job': How a fake terror plot consumed parliament

image.altText: Woman posed for a photoin nature, wearing a patterned dress

props.synopsis: Deanne Mathews, a self-described "healer and mentor", pleads guilty to drug trafficking after serving magic mushrooms to a woman who died at a Victorian health retreat.

title.children: 'Healer' who served mushroom drink to woman who died pleads guilty to drug charge

image.altText: A young man crouched and holding two fingers up

props.synopsis: Ten of 12 men accused of killing teenager Girum Mekonnen in a Brisbane park in a "revenge" attack have been found guilty of murder.

title.children: Ten of 12 men found guilty of murdering Brisbane teen in mass brawl

image.altText: Clayton's Towing to the rescue after couple drives into floodwaters

props.synopsis: A woman who was trapped in a ute after it ploughed into floodwaters amid record rainfall is speaking out to thank her rescuers and warn even the most wary of motorists.

title.children: Chilling video shows couple accidentally hitting floodwater
